trans-unit.source: Attribute that indicates that the property represents a navigation property.

The <xref:System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.EdmRelationshipNavigationPropertyAttribute> links the navigation property of a class to the navigation property of an entity type that is defined in the conceptual model.
This attribute is applied to the following types of navigation properties:
Properties that return an <xref:System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.EntityCollection%601> of related objects.
Properties that return the value of the <xref:System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.EntityReference%601> of a related object, as in the following example from the `SalesOrderDetail` type.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.EdmRelationshipNavigationPropertyAttribute"></xref> class.
The relationship name should not contain a namespace.
If you add the namespace to the relationship name, for example '*MyNamespace*.*MyRelationship*', an error will occur.
The namespace name of the relationship property.
The name of the relationship.
The relationship name is not namespace qualified.
The role name at the other end of the relationship.
Gets the unqualified relationship name.
The relationship name is not namespace qualified.
The name of the relationship is specified by the `Name` attribute of the `Association` element that defines this relationship in the conceptual model.
For more information, see [Association Element (CSDL)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/c305169a-8af7-432f-9ba7-800a163aed41).
The relationship name.
The namespace name of the navigation property.
The namespace of the relationship is specified by the `Namespace` attribute of the `Schema` element that contains the association that defines this relationship in the conceptual model.
For more information, see [Association Element (CSDL)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/c305169a-8af7-432f-9ba7-800a163aed41).
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that is the namespace name.
Gets the role name at the other end of the relationship.
The target role name is specified by the `Role` attribute of the other `End` element in the association that defines this relationship in the conceptual model.
For more information, see [Association Element (CSDL)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/c305169a-8af7-432f-9ba7-800a163aed41).
